name: appropriated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
appropriate
appropriate verb [T]
(TAKE)
to take something for your own use, usually without permission: He lost his job when he was found to have appropriated some of the company's money.
disapproving to take something from a culture and use it as part of your own: As the empire expanded, they eagerly appropriated the artistic styles of neigbouring provinces.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Taking things away from someone or somewhere
appropriate verb [T]
(KEEP MONEY)
to keep an amount of money to use for a particular purpose: The government have appropriated millions of pounds for the project.
